golad.lib

Interface MoveFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMoveFactory, DefaultAbstractMoveFactory

    public interface MoveFactory
    Used by Bots to obtain the current state of the Board, to create Moves and to check them for validity upon creation.
    Author:
    Megacrafter127
    See Also:
    Move, Board, Bot

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Move createBirthMove(int x, int y, int[] sx, int[] sy)
      Creates a valid move that creates an allied cell on the board.
      Move createKillMove(int killX, int killY)
      Creates a valid Move that kills a cell on the board.
      Move createTestMove(Board board, CellState player, Move.Type type, int x, int y, int[] sx, int[] sy)
      Creates a Move validated against the provided Board for the provided player.
      Board getBoard()
      Returns the Board used for the validation of Moves.
      CellState getPlayerColor()
      Returns the CellState representing an alive cell owned by the player that is given this MoveFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerColor

        CellState getPlayerColor()
        Returns the CellState representing an alive cell owned by the player that is given this MoveFactory. Returns null if this MoveFactory is given to multiple players or has no associated player.
        Returns:
        the CellState representing an allied cell

      • getBoard

        Board getBoard()
        Returns the Board used for the validation of Moves.
        Returns:
        the Board used for the validation of Moves

      • createKillMove

        Move createKillMove(int killX,
                  int killY)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Creates a valid Move that kills a cell on the board. If the created Move would be invalid this method must throw an Exception.
        Parameters:
        killX - The X coordinate of the cell to kill
        killY - The Y coordinate of the cell to kill
        Returns:
        The valid Move that will kill the specified cell
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the cell at the specified coordinates is not alive or killing it violates the rules.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified coordinates lie outside of the Board the moves are validated against.

      • createBirthMove

        Move createBirthMove(int x,
                   int y,
                   int[] sx,
                   int[] sy)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException,
                            IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Creates a valid move that creates an allied cell on the board. If the created Move would be invalid this method must throw an Exception.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the cell to create
        y - The Y coordinate of the cell to create
        sx - The X coordinates of the allied sacrificed cells
        sy - The Y coordinates of the allied sacrificed cells
        Returns:
        The valid Move that will create the specified cell
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If sx.length or sy.length do not match Move.Type.BIRTH.sacrifices, or if the cell at the specified coordinates is alive, any of the sacrificed cells are dead or not allied, or the creation of a cell at the specified location using the specified sacrifices violates the rules.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any of the specified coordinates lie outside of the Board the moves are validated against.

      • createTestMove

        Move createTestMove(Board board,
                  CellState player,
                  Move.Type type,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int[] sx,
                  int[] sy)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           NullPointerException,
                           IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Creates a Move validated against the provided Board for the provided player.
        Parameters:
        board - The Board to validate the created Move against
        player - The player to validate the created Move for
        type - The Type of Move
        x - The X coordinate of the targeted cell
        y - The Y coordinate of the targeted cell
        sx - The X coordinates of sacrificed allied cells
        sy - The Y coordinates of sacrificed allied cells
        Returns:
        The created Move
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If player is CellState.DEAD, sx or sy} do not match type.sacrifices or the created Move is invalid.
        NullPointerException - If board, player, type, sx or sy are null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any of the supplied coordinates lie outside of board.
